q: Without the confidence, nothing can be accomplished.
h:
“Without the confidence, nothing can be accomplished.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Showing off is the fool's idea of glory.
h:
“Showing off is the fool's idea of glory. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.
h:
“Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night.
h:
“One of the oldest human needs is having someone to wonder where you are when you don't come home at night. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: The majority of what you want will come from the minority of what you do.
h:
“The majority of what you want will come from the minority of what you do.” —
Gary Keller

q: Fools read fast. Geniuses reread.
h:
“Fools read fast. Geniuses reread.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.
h:
“Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.” —
Robin Sharma

q: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
h:
“I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.” —
Og Mandino

q: We will now discuss in a little more detail the Struggle for Existence.
h:
“We will now discuss in a little more detail the Struggle for Existence.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.
h:
“Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: A rational person can find peace by cultivating indifference to things outside of their control.
h:
“A rational person can find peace by cultivating indifference to things outside of their control.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: A man with outward courage dares to die: a man with inner courage dares to live.
h:
“A man with outward courage dares to die: a man with inner courage dares to live.” —
Lao Tzu

q: The less you try to impress, the more peaceful you can be.
h:
“The less you try to impress, the more peaceful you can be.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
h:
“You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do. ” —
Henry Ford

q: The source of a true smile is an awakened mind.
h:
“The source of a true smile is an awakened mind.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: No experience is a cause of success or failure. We do not suffer from the shock of our experiences, so-called trauma - but we make out of them just what suits our purposes.
h:
“No experience is a cause of success or failure. We do not suffer from the shock of our experiences, so-called trauma - but we make out of them just what suits our purposes.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Be as simple as you can be; you will be astonished to see how uncomplicated and happy your life can become.
h:
“Be as simple as you can be; you will be astonished to see how uncomplicated and happy your life can become.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: You use a glass mirror to see your face; you use works of art to see your soul.
h:
“You use a glass mirror to see your face; you use works of art to see your soul.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: It is easy to discover what another has discovered before.
h:
“It is easy to discover what another has discovered before.” —
Christopher Columbus

q: Being wrong opens us up to the possibility of change.
h:
“Being wrong opens us up to the possibility of change.” —
Mark Manson

q: Anyone who has ever made anything of importance was disciplined.
h:
“Anyone who has ever made anything of importance was disciplined.” —
Andrew Hendrixson

q: Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.
h:
“Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Information changes your mind. Action changes your circumstances.
h:
“Information changes your mind. Action changes your circumstances.” —
Jack Butcher

q: The busy man is never wise and the wise man is never busy.
h:
“The busy man is never wise and the wise man is never busy.” —
Lin Yutang

q: Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.
h:
“Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The greatest of all mistakes is to do nothing because you think you can only do a little.
h:
“The greatest of all mistakes is to do nothing because you think you can only do a little. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: A mountain never yields to the wind no matter how strong it is.
h:
“A mountain never yields to the wind no matter how strong it is.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Identification with our mind causes thought to become compulsive.
h:
“Identification with our mind causes thought to become compulsive.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Nothing ever happened in the past that can prevent you from being present now; and if the past cannot prevent you from being present now, what power does it have?
h:
“Nothing ever happened in the past that can prevent you from being present now; and if the past cannot prevent you from being present now, what power does it have?” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.
h:
“Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: Focused, hard work is the real key to success.
h:
“Focused, hard work is the real key to success.” —
John Carmack

q: Everything starts with a dream. A particle of our imagination that teases us of what the future could be like, as long as we fight for it.
h:
“Everything starts with a dream. A particle of our imagination that teases us of what the future could be like, as long as we fight for it.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: No one can compete with you on being you. Most of life is a search for who and what needs you the most.
h:
“No one can compete with you on being you. Most of life is a search for who and what needs you the most.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: People have the illusion that all over the world, all the time, all kinds of fantastic things are happening.
h:
“People have the illusion that all over the world, all the time, all kinds of fantastic things are happening.” —
David Brinkley

q: No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself or to get all the credit for doing it.
h:
“No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself or to get all the credit for doing it.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.
h:
“Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: The way of success is the way of continuous pursuit of knowledge.
h:
“The way of success is the way of continuous pursuit of knowledge.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
h:
“There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.” —
Plato

q: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today.
h:
“Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Keep your dreams, you never know when you might need them.
h:
“Keep your dreams, you never know when you might need them.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: You can calculate the worth of a man by the number of his enemies.
h:
“You can calculate the worth of a man by the number of his enemies.” —
Gustave Flaubert

q: The wise man reads both books and life itself.
h:
“The wise man reads both books and life itself.” —
Lin Yutang

q: You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.
h:
“You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
h:
“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Don't change your mind just because people are offended; change your mind if you're wrong.
h:
“Don't change your mind just because people are offended; change your mind if you're wrong.” —
Criss Jami

q: Debt is the slavery of the free.
h:
“Debt is the slavery of the free.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: The purpose of life is to contribute in some way to making things better.
h:
“The purpose of life is to contribute in some way to making things better.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
h:
“You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.” —
James Allen

q: Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.
h:
“Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: The sun shines upon good and bad alike.
h:
“The sun shines upon good and bad alike.” —
Hans Christian Andersen
